name: climactic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
forming or relating to the most important or exciting point in a story or situation, especially when this happens near the end: The film ends with a climactic battle scene. The third movement of the symphony ends in a climactic crescendo (= has a loud and exciting ending). See
climax
More examplesFewer examplesFinally, the climactic moment came.A new element entered into the climactic final weeks of the election campaign. The climactic event was the 400-meter relay.
